Uses

Treatment of arthri

READ MORE
precautions: You may be more sensitive to the sun with this drop. In the heat, limit your time. Stop sunlamps and tanning boots. Extremes like wind or cold weather can even irritate the eye area.Tell your doctor or pharmacist about any infections (e.g., tuberculosis, herpes, fungal infections), kidney disease, liver disease, mental/mood conditions (e.g., psychosis, anxiety, depression), low blood minerals (e.g., low potassium/calcium), thyroid disease, stomach/intestinal problems before taking this medication.Do not stop taking this drug without your doctor consulting. If this drug comes off suddenly, certain conditions may get worse. You may need to decrease your dose gradually. It is contraindicated in patients with known hypersensitivity to the drug.
effects: After applying the drug, a quick sensation of warmth or stinging may occur. During the first 2-4 weeks of using the drug, skin redness, dryness, scratching, scaling, mild burning, or deterioration may occur. Using constantly, these effects generally decrease. Tell your doctor or pharmacist quickly if any of these symptoms persist or get worse. You may want your doctor to reduce the frequency at which you use, change your intensity or avoid using it. Do not use or use a greater quantity as directed. Your skin won't improve more easily, and you are more likely to experience side effects (e.g., redness, peeling, or pain). Stinging or Burning of the eyes for 1 to 2 minutes.

precautions: Like every other medicine, this medicine should also be taken with some precautions. A person who is allergic to betamethasone can also be a victim of severe damage.The person wearing the lenses should remove the lenses before infusing them as the chemical formula may react with the lens and can destroy its color or may react harshly.For use in the nose, it should not be used for a long duration as it may create swelling in the nostrils. As far as pregnancy or lactation is concerned, betnesol in pregnancy is considered safe till now as no harm is reported. Anyhow, still expecting or latching mother should concern doctor before using any medicines.Besides the precautions, like any other medical drops, betnesol drops should also be kept out of reach of children. It should be used according to the doctor's prescription; especially the people with other diseases like high blood pressure or sugar should inform their physician before processing the treatment.
effects: Like other medicines, these are betnesol drops that can produce or may not produce side effects among their users. Betnesol side effects include soreness in the outer surface of the eye.It may make the visibility smoggy with some pain. Anyhow, if it doesn't improve, do consult the doctor.Other possible side effects include swelling of eyelids, itchiness, or redness around the corners of the eyes.While using for the nose, many possible side effects may occur. It may include problems in breathing, ulcers, or itchiness in the nostrils. You may feel the need to sneeze a lot or may face the trauma of a headache.In other cases, the person may feel sick due to irritation, may face a blocked nose, or in severe cases, may bleed the nose. Change in smell or loss of smell sense is also one of the side effects of being TESOL drops.Besides the upper narrated side effects, other side effects may include a runny nose, low blood pressure, or muscular pain. precautions: Some of the Femicon eye drops precautions are listed below. To get immediate relief from the eye medical problem, carefully experience all its cautions.Before taking the Femicon eye drops, inform the doctor about your medical history, especially if you suffer from glaucoma.If you are taking any supplements. If you are allergic to the components used in the Femicon eye drops formula.If you are following any other medical prescription at the same time.Avoid its use for a long time.Avoid consuming alcohol while taking this medicine.Avoid driving.Keep the medicine at room temperature.Keep the medicine away from children's reach.Check the expiry date before using it.Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of, Eye infections, Recent eye surgery, Cataracts, Glaucoma (open-angle type), Myopia, Diabetes.
effects: Femicon eye drops can cause some side effects, but every patient using the Femicon eye drops maybe not have experienced some or all of its side effects. However, Femicon eye drops side effects are listed below.The common side effects caused by the Femicon eye drops are burning of eyes, temporary blurred vision, and headache. These side effects may disappear as the patient's body adjusts to the medicine.The rare but severe side effects reported while taking the Femicon eye drops are optic nerve damage, posterior subcapsular cataract formation, and delayed wound healing.If any of the side effects persist or you notice that the condition worsens, you should inform the doctor and take necessary medical help. Stinging/burning of the eyes for 1 to 2 minutes and temporary blurred vision may occur when you apply this medication.

title: Exocin Eye Drops
details:
Exocin Eye drops are antibacterial eye drops. It is used to treat bacterial infections of the eyes. It helps in stopping the growth of the bacteria and helps in treating the infection caused by it. It should be used on the external side only. The

READ MORE
precautions: Do not use exotic eye drops with contact lenses on. Wash your hands before using the drops.If you are allergic to quinone based antibiotics, then you should not use this medication at all. Since the eye drops to enter the bloodstream, it is advised to not use them during pregnancy without consulting a doctor.Read the leaflet carefully to know about the ingredients present in the eye drops. This medication is considered safe for children over the age of 6 years old.Store it at a cool and dry placePatients with hypertension or blood pressure problems must use the medicine if it is needed clearly, otherwise do not use the medication and also, it is advised not to use it excessively since it is an antibiotic and may alter the blood pressure levels. Diabetic patients should also use the medication on the doctor's advice clearly. People with a history of cardiac disorders should only use the eye drops only on a doctor's prescription because it may make the situation worse due to the presence of quinone antibiotics. Do not use it after opening the seal after a month.Patients suffering from kidney disease must use the drops on the doctor's recommendation only. Since the drops contain antibiotics, it can be dangerous for kidney patients. Do not touch the tip with dirty hands to avoid bacterial contamination. Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of other eye problems. This drug may cause temporary Blurred or Unstable vision after you apply it. Do not drive, use machinery, or do any activity that requires clear vision until you are sure you can perform such activities safely.
effects: Every medicine has some side effects and some benefits. The side effects might not be experienced by everyone, but few individuals might experience the side effects due to allergies to any of the substances present in the medicine. Some of the side effects of this eye drop are temporary, while others are permanent. The following list contains some of the side effects associated with the use of this medication. Burning sensation in the eyesRedness or itchiness in the eyesSevere or sharp pain in the eyesBlurry visionEyes become sensitive to light, also called as photophobiaDizziness or DrowsinessHeadache Agitation or lethargyShortness of breathIrregular heartbeatAbnormal Heart rateNausea or VomitingIrritable Bowel Syndrome such as diarrhoea or constipation. Headache Agitation or Lethargy This medication may temporarily sting or burn your eyes for a minute or two when applied. title: Nebra 5ML Eye Drops
details:
Nebra eye drops belong to the category of medicines known as aminoglycoside antibiotics. It can only treat bacterial infections. This medication provides relief from all kinds of infections, from mild to severe, that are caused by bacteria.

READ MORE
precautions: Before using this medication, inform the doctor about your complete medical history in detail. Read the leaflet and check the list of ingredients specifically. If you are allergic to any of the ingredients present in the medicine, do not use the medicine.People suffering from kidney problems or hypertension must also avoid using this medication because it may worsen the situation.Pregnant women should also avoid using any kind of medication without a doctor's consultation. Breast-feeding mothers should also use the medication only on the doctor's advice because what the mother eats passes into the baby through breast milk. Store it in a cool and dry place.Excessive or unnecessary of medication halts its working, so it is better to use the medication only for the time it is required. Keep the drops away from children’s reach.Do not use the eye drops after one month of opening its seal. Do not recommend the medication to others on your own. It is contraindicated in patients with known hypersensitivity to the drug.
effects: Likewise, every other medicine this medicine also has some side effects. However, everyone doesn't need to experience the same side effects. Some people might not experience any side effects. Others might get severe allergic reactions after using these drops. The following list contains some of the side effects associated with the use of this medication. If any of the following side-effects persists or worsens, seek medical assistance immediately. Itching or burning of eyesSwelling of eyesRednessTearingDrowsiness or DizzinessThe appearance of rashes on the face.Swelling of face, tongue, and feetDark yellow colored urineShortness of breath.Stinging/burning of the eyes for 1 to 2 minutes.

details: It is used to treat a variety of Bacterial Eye infections.
precautions: Tell your doctor/Pharmacist your medical history of Diabetes, Recent heart attack, Tendonitis, Bursitis, Liver disease, Depression, Myasthenia gravis, Peripheral neuropathy, Seizure disorder, Conditions that increase your risk of seizures such as Brain/Head injury, Brain tumors, Cerebral atherosclerosis, Aneurysm or blockage of the aorta or other Blood vessels, Hardening of the arteries, Hypertension, Marfan syndrome, Ehlers-Danlos syndrome. During pregnancy, this medication should be used only when clearly needed. Discuss the risks and benefits with your doctor.
effects: Nausea, Diarrhea, Dizziness, Lightheadedness, Headache, Weakness, or Trouble sleeping may occur.

title: Natasan Eye Drops
details: This medicine is used to treat fungal eye infections. It works by stopping the growth of certain types of fungus.
precautions: Before using natamycin, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. For keratitis, consider alternative medicine if no improvement in 7-10 days. After you apply this drug, your vision may become temporarily blurred. Do not drive, use machinery, or do any activity that requires clear vision until you are sure you can perform such activities safely.
effects: It can cause Allergic reaction, including rash, itching/swelling (especially of the face/tongue/throat), severe dizziness, trouble breathing.

title: Izilon 5ML Eye Drops
details: It’s a broad-spectrum antibiotic. Used to treat a broad range of infectious diseases caused by bacteria. Effective against gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria.
precautions: Keep out of the reach of children. Protect from direct exposure to sunlight, and heat. Store below the room temperature.
effects: In some cases, it may cause mild to moderate adverse reactions. In the case of side effects, discontinue the use and try to find a doctor. Major Side effects may include, irritations, itching, rashes, redness, and, swelling, etc Consult a doctor, if you have hypersensitivity to any of its ingredients.

title: Ciloxan 5ML Eye Drops
details: It is used for the treatment of severe bacterial infections.
precautions: Use with caution having Diabetes, Heart problems, Kidney disease, Liver disease, Depression, Myasthenia gravis, Peripheral neuropathy, High blood pressure.
effects: Nausea, Diarrhea, Dizziness, Lightheadedness, Headache, Trouble sleeping.
